Package seng202.group2.view

Class MapController

java.lang.Object
seng202.group2.controller.DataObserver
seng202.group2.view.MapController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MapController
extends DataObserver
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Map Controller is the controller class for the Map GUI This class uses the 'map.fxml' FXML file for laying it out in JavaFX and map.html for displaying the Google Map API in JavaFX's WebView Element. This GUI provides a mapping visualisation of the current ActiveData.
Author:
Yiyang Yu, Connor Dunlop, George Hampton, Sam Clark

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(java.net.URL location, java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
      Initialize the map window This method prepares the Map Window in the UI. It does the following preparations: - Add an observer to the activeData, which will be displayed as markers on the map. - Use webEngine to provide access to the document object model of the web page map.html
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • addMarker

      public void addMarker​(CrimeRecord record, java.lang.String color)
      Adds a marker to the map for a particular CrimeRecord. The marker is placed at the latitude and longitude stored by the CrimeRecord, where the crime occurred.
      Parameters:
      record - The record for which to add a map marker.

    • selectRecord

      public void selectRecord​(int id)
      Select a record by ID
      Parameters:

    • removeMarker

      public void removeMarker​(CrimeRecord record)
      Removes a marker corresponding to a particular CrimeRecord from the map.
      Parameters:
      record - The record whose map marker is to be removed.

    • showExportWindow

      public void showExportWindow()
      This showExportWindow method opens the export window and brings it to the front. It allows the user to export the current map window as a visual.
